data.title: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Degree Online: 10 Top Options
data.meta_description: Explore the best options for an Unmanned Aircraft Systems degree online and master drone systems, analyze data, and launch your UAS career!
data.meta_site_name: GetEducated | Review, Rate, Rank & Compare Online Colleges & Degrees
data.text:
Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University

Degree Offered: Associate of Science in Uncrewed Systems

Total Cost: $29,250 (In-State & Out-of-State)

Accreditation: SACSCOC

Embry-Riddle is renowned for its focus on aeronautics and aerospace, making its Associate of Science in Uncrewed Systems a top choice. Students can choose from 3 specialization options in pilot training, data analysis, or maintenance and repair. The pilot operations option offers rolling start dates, so you can start your education any time of the year. This unmanned aerial systems degree offers flexibility that’s perfect for those with busy schedules who need to balance their education with other commitments. The other two programs follow a semester-based system, with start dates in the fall and spring. They’re more suitable for students who prefer a more structured environment and enjoy collaborating with classmates in real-time.

The unmanned aircraft systems degree online is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of UAS, therefore preparing students for various roles in the industry. It stands out for its blend of practical skills and theoretical knowledge. Prospective Students should be prepared for a rigorous program that combines technical and operational aspects of UAS.

A unique feature of all of Embry-Riddle’s programs is the strong connection the school has to the aerospace industry, thereupon offering significant networking opportunities and potential career pathways. What’s more, while the programs are primarily online, they offers additional in-person workshops at various locations, providing a valuable opportunity for hands-on training and interaction with fellow students and instructors face-to-face. The hybrid approach balances the convenience of online learning with the benefits of practical experience.

Overall, Embry-Riddle aims to select students who demonstrate a strong academic foundation and the potential to succeed in a rigorous online environment. A high school transcript with a GPA of 2.5 is also required.

Associate of Science in Uncrewed Systems

Lenoir Community College

Degree Offered: Associate in Applied Science in Pilot Unmanned Aircraft Systems

Total Cost: $5,370 (In-State)

Total Cost: $18,234 (Out-of-State)

Accreditation: SACSCOC

This program focuses on the piloting aspects of and unmanned aircraft systems degree online, offering hands-on experience in drone operation. Due to its balance of technical training and applied skills, LCC’s program is ideal for those seeking a practical approach. Prospective Students should anticipate an immersive experience in UAS operations, as well as a strong emphasis on real-world applications.

A key component of this unmanned aerial systems degree is the use of manned aircraft simulators, which enrich students’ understanding of aviation.The Redbird FMX simulators are available online, meaning you can complete your flight training and practice maneuvers from anywhere with a stable internet connection. You’ll engage in specialized projects across various fields such as agriculture, construction, and search-and-rescue. The program is particularly well-suited for those aspiring to become professional drone pilots in various industries, including agriculture, surveillance, and media.

In addition, the curriculum is designed to allow credits to transfer seamlessly to four-year universities, providing students with flexible pathways to further their education in aviation or related fields.

Associate in Applied Science in Pilot Unmanned Aircraft Systems

Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University

Degree Offered: Bachelor of Science in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems

Total Cost: $58,400 (In-State & Out-of-State)

Accreditation: SACSCOC

Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University’s Bachelor of Science in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems stands out for its comprehensive approach to UAS and UAS. This pioneering program, available fully online, equips students with skills for roles in various sectors, including administrative, operations, and development in the uncrewed systems industry. It covers a wide range of applications in air, space, ground, and maritime domains. In addition, ERAU continually updates their curriculum to meet new industry standards. Notably, the program boasts a high post-graduation placement rate of 83%, with alumni earning competitive salaries. It also offers unique opportunities like FAA Part 107 certification and a specialized residency program for professional drone pilot training. To be sure, Embry-Riddle is one of the most sought-after and recognized UAS schools in the industry.

The drone pilot residency program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University is a standout feature of their Bachelor of Science in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems. This unique unmanned aircraft systems degree online offers intensive training for students, preparing them to meet the highest industry standards in drone piloting. It includes practical, hands-on experience and is conducted over a weekend session, twice a year. This valuable opportunity for real-world application of their skills is held at the university’s Daytona Beach, Florida campus.

Finally, ERAU offers the 4+1 program to exceptional students who are committed to continuing their education through the Master’s degree. This fast-paced program allows qualifying students the opportunity to complete both the Bachelor of Science in Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems (BSUAS) and the Master of Science in Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems (MSUAS) in just five years.

Bachelor of Science in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems

Kansas State University

Degree Offered: Bachelor’s Degree in Machine Learning and Autonomous Systems

Total Cost: $42,144 (In-State & Out-of-State)

Accreditation: HLC

Kansas State University’s Bachelor’s Degree in Machine Learning and Autonomous Systems is especially for those eager to shape the future of technology, particularly in areas like healthcare, workplace safety, transportation, and space exploration. This unmanned aircraft systems degree online emphasizes hands-on learning in the design, development, and deployment of machine learning and AI within autonomous systems. Students have the option to specialize in two tracks: Web Development and Computational Core.

The Web Development Track focuses on fundamental web technologies and programming, ideal for students interested in web-based applications of machine learning. The Computational Core Track, on the other hand, delves deeper into data structures, algorithms, and advanced programming, suited for those looking to work on the technical side of machine learning and autonomous systems.

Graduates of this program have a wide range of career options, including roles such as machine learning engineer, AI engineer, data scientist, and big data engineer. This degree paves the way for entering a field with a projected job growth of 15%, addressing the shortage of skilled professionals in this rapidly evolving industry.

KSU practices a holistic admissions policy, using factors such as GPA, SAT/ACT scores, essays and personal statements, letters of recommendation, as well as extracurricular activities and work experience.

Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology / Machine Learning & Autonomous Systems

Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University

Degree Offered: Master of Science in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems and Master of Science in Unmanned & Autonomous Systems Engineering

Total Cost: $24,330

Accreditation: SACSCOC

Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University offers two Master of Science programs in Uncrewed & Autonomous Systems (MSUAS) and Unmanned & Autonomous Systems Engineering (MSUASEN). All in all, both programs provide in-depth knowledge and skills in the cutting-edge field of unmanned and autonomous systems. The curriculum blends theory with practical application, so it’s suitable for those looking to enhance their careers in various sectors including aerospace, defense, and civil applications. Both programs require 30 credit hours for completion.

To enroll in the MSUAS program, students must obtain an FAA Part 107 and complete a residency program that trains professional drone pilots to the highest industry standards. The residency program is scheduled two weekends a year, in December and May, in Daytona Beach, Florida, at the Worldwide Headquarters. A 3.0 GPA, GRE, and a complete application package including a resume, three letters of recommendation, and a statement of objectives are required by both programs.

Additionally, applicants to the MSUASEN program must have a bachelor’s degree in an ABET-accredited engineering discipline or a related field. However, Embry-Riddle alumni and graduates from non-ERAU ABET-accredited programs may be considered for conditional admission, which may involve completing additional undergraduate engineering courses.

Master of Science in Unmanned & Autonomous Systems Engineering

Master of Science in Unmanned Systems

Capitol Technology University

Degree Offered: Master of Science in Unmanned & Autonomous Systems

Total Cost: $22,227

Accreditation: HLC

The online Master of Science in Uncrewed and Autonomous Systems at Capitol Technology University is specifically for those seeking to advance in the rapidly growing field of UAS. This program, besides covering traditional aviation and military applications, extends to sectors like agriculture, emergency services, and environmental science. It offers foundational knowledge in UAS policy, risk management, and a variety of technical skills. The program is flexible and online, with many classes offered in asynchronous format, and the option to participate in a live, virtual classroom format in which you can interact with your instructor and fellow students in real time. All live classes are recorded and available for later replay. Classes are kept intentionally small, to deliver the best possible experience to students and train. Finally, the school provides access to top experts and global networks, including a partnership with the Royal Aeronautical Society.

This unmanned aircraft systems degree online offers comprehensive training in the design, control, and application of uncrewed systems. It goes into the ethical, legal, and public policy aspects of the field, ensuring a holistic understanding. The program blends theoretical knowledge, practical application, and research, offering a dynamic and innovative learning experience. It’s designed for both aspiring UAS professionals and those aiming to become certified UAS operators, with an option to prepare for the FAA Part 107 test.

Applicants to this program should have a bachelor’s degree in a STEM field, with at least a 3.0 GPA. Relevant work experience and GRE scores are optional, but they can boost your chances of admission. Finally, students must also submit 2 letters of recommendation and a statement of purpose.

Master of Science in Unmanned & Autonomous Systems

University of Cincinnati

Degree Offered: Master of Engineering in Robotics & Intelligent Autonomous Systems

Total Cost: $31,200

Accreditation: HLC

The University of Cincinnati’s M. Eng. in Robotics and Intelligent Autonomous Systems program is the perfect opportunity for students who want to advance the state of the art in these fields. The program offers specialized training in computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, systems engineering, and project management. In other words, it provides students with a broad set of skills necessary to build reliable, safe, secure, and trusted systems of the future. The Master of Engineering degree is designed to enhance professionals’ ability to contribute to the technical workforce, and the program offers advanced training to students interested in expanding their knowledge and expertise. The program is practice-oriented and focused on providing the skills and expertise industries need in today’s competitive technology environment.

Those with an undergraduate degree in engineering, engineering technology, or computer science from an ABET-accredited program with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better, are the ideal candidates for this degree. However, graduates from other majors can still be considered by submitting additional materials that demonstrate their ability to be successful in this program. With the University of Cincinnati and all regional campuses accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, students can be sure that they’re receiving the highest quality education possible.

UC offers a flat-rate tuition, so students can save both time and money with full-time enrollment and completion of the program within two semesters.

Master of Engineering in Robotics & Intelligent Autonomous Systems

Michigan Technological University

Program: Graduate Certificate in Safety & Security of Autonomous Cyber-Physical Systems

Total Cost: $23,391

Accreditation: HLC

The Graduate Certificate in Safety and Security of Autonomous Cyber-Physical Systems at Michigan Technological University is a 15-credit-hour program that can be completed in 1-3 semesters, depending on the student’s availability and course load. The program focuses on the safety and security aspects of modern control networks and interconnected system complexes, such as autonomous vehicles. It covers the competencies involved in becoming a fully-functioning unmanned aerial systems operator. That is, designing, controlling, and integrating cyber-physical components and systems. It emphasizes threat analysis, vulnerability assessment, and fault tolerance in mobility platforms, applicable not just to vehicles but also to robots, manufacturing, and infrastructure.

This fully online certificate program requires an undergraduate degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or a related field. There is no GRE requirement, but applicants must have a 3.0 or better GPA. The school admits students for fall, spring, and summer terms on a rolling basis.

Graduate Certificate in Safety & Security of Autonomous Cyber-Physical Systems

Clemson University

Program: Graduate Certificate in Autonomous and Robotic Systems

Total Cost: $18,432 in state: $36,684 Out of State

Accreditation: SACSCOC

Clemson University’s Graduate Certificate in Autonomous and Robotic Systems empowers working professionals and current students with industry-focused expertise in this rapidly evolving field. During this 12-credit hour program, offered by the Department of Mechanical Engineering, students delve into topics like human-robot interaction, mechatronics, robot dynamics, and reinforcement learning, preparing you for the role of unmanned aircraft systems operator.

Designed for graduates in engineering, math, or physics with a minimum GPA of 3.0, the certificate equips you with the skills to design, build, and operate autonomous robots, tackle complex engineering challenges, and open doors to exciting career opportunities across various industries. Students may begin the course during the fall or spring semester and can complete this certificate program in as little as one semester. Clemson also allows students to stack graduate certificates toward completion of a master’s degree. Although this program doesn’t require a GRE, applicants must provide a resume, 2 reference letters, and a statement of purpose.

Graduate Certificate in Autonomous and Robotic Systems

Stanford University

Program: Graduate Certificate in Robotics & Autonomous Systems

Total Cost: $31,200

Accreditation: WSCUC

Stanford University’s Graduate Certificate in Robotics and Autonomous Systems unlocks the world of intelligent machines and equips students with the theoretical and practical expertise to navigate this dynamic field. This certificate is ideal for engineers, programmers, or anyone fascinated with the field of intelligent machines. Offered through the prestigious online platform, this program caters to both working professionals and current students seeking to develop their understanding and advance their careers in robotics and autonomous systems.

Besides the program being 100% online, it offers self-paced learning modules, so students can complete them around other commitments. The advanced curriculum will explore topics like planning, search, localization, tracking, and control. It also insights into algorithms and methods that make robots work optimally. Hands-on projects and assignments will help bridge the gap between theory and real-world scenarios, and students will emerge prepared to design and build intelligent machines that interact seamlessly with the real world.

To join this unmanned aircraft systems degree online, students need a strong academic foundation, with a minimum 3.5 GPA in majors like engineering or math. Students should complete a pre-knowledge assessment for a core course, and submit a personal statement and two letters of recommendation.
